means: 丢脸
耻辱
不光彩
丢脸的人（或事）
使丢脸
使失宠
使受耻辱
贬黜
[电影]耻
声名狼藉

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"使丢脸，使受耻辱"之意。
means: disgrace ： 侧重在别人，尤其在众人面前丢脸。
humiliate ： 强调受辱者自尊心的损坏。
shame ： 指由不光彩或不道德的行为引起的惭愧感或羞耻感。
dishonour ： 有时可与disgrace换用，但前者是指因失去荣誉所致。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"使丢脸，使受耻辱"之意。
means: humble常可和degrade换用，强调降级所带来的耻辱；也多指自卑和感到渺小无能的心理状态。
humiliate ： 指损伤或剥夺自尊感，损坏自尊心，强调蒙受耻辱。
degrade ： 指因过失而受到降级、阶格；也多指因自身的境遇而感到耻辱。
disgrace ： 指降低某人在他人心目中的地位，使其丢脸。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"丢脸，羞愧"之意。
means: shame ： 多指因非法婚烟、私生、卖国或犯法等而丢失脸面或败坏名声，使他人认为"丢脸"、"可耻"。
disgrace ： 常指失去他人的尊敬和称赞而使自己感受到的丢脸、耻辱。
embarrassment ： 多指在社交活动中所遇到的尴尬事。
dishonour ： 指失去原来享有的光荣或自尊和自重。

sentence.Network_en: Republican leaders called him a disgrace to the party.
sentence.Network_cn: 共和党领导人称他是全党的耻辱。

sentence.Network_en: What went on was a scandal. It was a disgrace to Britain.
sentence.Network_cn: 发生的一切是个丑闻，是给英国抹黑。

sentence.Network_en: Kinkel said the attacks had brought disgrace on Germany.
sentence.Network_cn: 金克尔声称这次袭击使德国蒙羞。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 大学英语精读单词表(第一册) - 豆丁网 ... sob vi. 啜泣；呜咽 disgrace n. 耻辱；丢脸的人(或事) unhappy a. 不幸的，不快乐的.
大学英语六级词汇表 - 豆丁网 ... discrimination n． 辨别；识别力；歧视 disgrace n． 失宠，耻辱，丢脸 disillusion n． 觉醒.
职称英语A级词汇 - 豆丁网 ... discriminate v. 区别，辨别，区分；歧视 disgrace n. 丢脸；丢脸的人(事) disguise n. 假装；化装服.
（1）《屈辱》（disgrace）：获1983年布克奖（有中文版）（2）《麦克·K的生命与时代》（Life and Times of Michael.k）：获1999 …

list.abs: Doctors like that are a disgrace to our hospitals ., 那样的医生是我们医院的一种耻辱.
not to disgrace your profession or anything . there's three weeks left in school , just give me af * * king break !不是想玷污你的职业，现在只有三个星期的时间我就毕业了，就不能让我屏蔽词语休息一下！
I would rather die than disgrace myself ., 我宁死不受辱.
体面的的英文... ... 体面的恶棍 ： an honorable villain 不体面的行为 ： disgraceful conduct 不体面的行为 ： shameful behavior.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (as a verb): via French from Italian disgrazia (noun), disgraziare (verb), from dis- (expressing reversal) + Latin gratia 'grace'

encyclopedia.content: 图书信息 作 者/Author:J. M. Coetzee（约翰·马克斯韦尔·库切） 著 出版社/Publisher:Penguin US 中文书名/Chinese Title：耻 ISBN:9780143115281 出版时间/Publication Date:2008-08-27 页 数/Pages:224 装 帧/Format：平装 纸 张/Paper：胶版纸 正文语种/Language：英文 内容简介 Disgrace--set in post--apartheid Cape Town and on a remote farm in the Eastern Cape--is deft,lean,quiet,and brutal. A heartbreaking nov

entry.def: If you say that someone is in disgrace, you are emphasizing that other people disapprove of them and do not respect them because of something that they have done.

example.ex: His vice president also had to resign in disgrace...
example.tran: 他的副总统也被迫不光彩地辞去职务。

example.ex: She has brought disgrace upon womankind.

entry.def: If you say that something is a disgrace, you are emphasizing that it is very bad or wrong, and that you find it completely unacceptable.

example.ex: The way the sales were handled was a complete disgrace...
example.tran: 这种销售手段为人所不齿。

example.ex: The national airline is a disgrace.

entry.def: You say that someone is a disgrace to someone else when you want to emphasize that their behaviour causes the other person to feel ashamed.

example.ex: Republican leaders called him a disgrace to the party...
example.tran: 共和党领导人称他是全党的耻辱。

example.ex: What went on was a scandal. It was a disgrace to Britain.
example.tran: 发生的一切是个丑闻，是给英国抹黑。

entry.def: If you say that someone disgraces someone else, you are emphasizing that their behaviour causes the other person to feel ashamed.

example.ex: I have disgraced my family's name...
I've disgraced myself by the actions I've taken.
example.tran: 我的行为让我颜面尽失。

sentences.sentence: "one mistake brought shame to all his family"
"suffered the ignominy of being sent to prison"
"he dishonored his family by committing a serious crime"

means.word_mean: 2. reduce in worth or character, usually verbally;

sentences.sentence: "She tends to put down younger women colleagues"
"His critics took him down after the lecture"

auth_sentence.content: They said I was a disgrace to Soviet pediatrics.
auth_sentence.res_content: They said I was a disgrace to Soviet pediatrics.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They said I was a disgrace to Soviet pediatrics.

auth_sentence.content: The handling of the spent fuel is a national disgrace.
auth_sentence.res_content: The handling of the spent fuel is a national disgrace.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The handling of the spent fuel is a national disgrace.

auth_sentence.content: By our actions today we disgrace their value.
auth_sentence.res_content: By our actions today we disgrace their value.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: By our actions today we disgrace their value.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 亲切的,客气的;宽厚的,仁慈的
stems_affixes.word_buile: grac=grace恩惠,恩泽+ious……的→adj.亲切的,客气的;宽厚的,仁慈的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 耻辱, 失宠, 丢脸的人[或事]
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis不+grace[n.优美,文雅;恩惠,恩泽;宽限,缓刑;感恩祷告]→不优美,不文雅→丢脸
dis不+grace[n.优美,文雅;恩惠,恩泽;宽限,缓刑;感恩祷告]→不优美,不文雅→丢脸

means.word_mean: 丢脸, 耻辱, 不光彩

sentences.en: You will bring disgrace on yourself by doing this.
sentences.cn: 你这样做会给自己带来耻辱。

means.word_mean: 丢脸的人(或事)；令人感到羞耻的人（或事）

sentences.en: He is a disgrace to our school.
Such an act is a disgrace to humanity.
sentences.cn: 这种行为是人类的耻辱。

sentences.en: They have disgraced the whole school.
sentences.cn: 他们给整个学校都丢了脸。

means.word_mean: 使名誉扫地；使失势；使失去地位；使失宠

jushi.english: He is a disgrace to our school.
What he did brought disgrace on our class.
jushi.chinese: 他的所作所为给我们班丢了脸。

jushi.english: Such an act is a disgrace to humanity.
jushi.chinese: 这种行为是人类的耻辱。
